lead_paragraph: The Episcopal Diocese of Maryland said Friday that a bishop accused of fatally striking a bicyclist while driving drunk in Baltimore has resigned.
snippet: The Episcopal Diocese of Maryland said Friday that a bishop accused of fatally striking a bicyclist while driving drunk in Baltimore has resigned.
abstract: Episcopal Diocese of Maryland accepts resignation of Heather Cook, onetime suffragan bishop facing manslaughter charges related to fatal drunk driving incident in Baltimore that killed bicyclist Tom Palermo; Episcopal Church has also revoked Cook's clergy credentials.
